Sequence Information.Peptide Name: hepcidin TH1-5 (Cys-rich 36%; 4S=S, natural AMPs; UCSS1a; fish, animals; TH2-2, inactive)

Literature Information.Literature: Active against Gram-  V.damsela (Not detected), V.vulnificus (not detected), Gram+ L. monocytogenes (MIC 100 ug/ml), S. aureus (MIC 50 ug/ml), and E. faecium (MIC 100 ug/ml).  It also showed antiviral activity against non-enveloped, spherical  virus (betanodavirus) (Wang Y et al. 2010 Peptides 31: 1026-33). TH1-5 induced necrosis with high-concentration treatment and induced apoptosis with low-concentration treatment (). Updated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Huang P, Chen J, Kuo C2007
Literature Information.Title: Three different hepcidins from tilapia, Oreochromis mossambicus: analysis of their expressions and biological functions
